reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I frequently stay at this hotel when in the Rochester area and have yet to have a bad experience. I concur with the previous reviews on the comfort of the bedding. The rooms actually have a doorbell. The town is very quaint, and the area is excellent for a nice walk in the morning. We finally took advantage of the adjacent bike path on the last visit (rental nearby) and it was a very good experience. There are also canal boat rides very close. The exercise room is very small, but they do offer passes to a larger heath club. There is an excellent full service spa attached to the hotel. Good selection of restaurants within walking distance. Great choice for a getaway weekend.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Del Monte for two nights to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary, while we toured the Finger Lakes area of upstate NY. While we chose this property because of the good reviews on this web site, we will return there because of the accomodations, and the five star service!
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel in Rochester, NY area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are Marriott rewards silver members, and Todd Plouffe, the general manager, upgraded us to a beautiful suite when I asked if we could get an upgraded room. Furthermore, upon our return from dinner one evening there was a complimentary bottle of Champaigne and chocolate covered strawberries for us in the suite! The entire staff obviously enjoy their job and are very good at what they do. We later learned that this property had been named "property of the year" by Marriott.
reviews.title: Loved the del monte!

reviews.text: Experience like this is what keeps us loyal to Marriott.
reviews.title: Exceptional Property!

likes.liked: — Clean, very comfortable and very quiet rooms

reviews.text: Service was fantastic and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I highly recc. this treasure in a quaint upstate town!
reviews.title: A fine, but noisy, hotel for a quick visit to Rochester
Heaven
reviews.text: Amazing. My new husband and I hosted our friends and family to our wedding at the DelMonte 3/3/06 and we were all treated to an amazing experience. The rooms are phenominal. Not overly spacious, but appointed with high-end linens, thick towels and the beds are so nice, you don't want to get out of it! What impreseed me the most is the service and attention to detail. I am a very detail oriented person, appreciate and pay attention to the "little things". This hotel has not overlooked one little thing. The staff in general are so gracious and helpful - I feel like there is nothing I could ask for that they wouldn't have accomodated. If you stay here (or better yet have a wedding or coroporate function) you MUST eat here. The food is the best I have ever had. All of our guests were also impressed - the quality, quantity and presentation were unforgettable. I do not believe the hotel deserves the three-star rating, as to me, this is better than many five-star hotels I have stayed at in major metro areas (Boston, Chicago). Lastly, treat yourself to a Spa treatmet if you can - again, gracious staff, warm interior and aromatic. I am so fond of this hotel and their staff I have "fired" my hair stylist of 20 years and now go to the DelMonte Spa for all of my beauty treatments - but I am lucky enough to live nearby. If you have any questions or hestistation at all, I'd be happy to answer any questions you might have. I can not say enough about this property as a whole. We are anxiously awaiting our first anniversary (and every anniversary after that) so we can stay there again to celebrate! Enjoy! shelley

reviews.title: Ab Fab
reviews.text: I have had the good fortune to have been able to stay at the RENAISSANCE DEL MONTE LODGE HOTEL AND SPA several times since December. It is Absolutely Fabulous. This is a beautiful hotel with all of the amenities and outstanding service. This is Marriott "done right". The rooms are great. The beds are the new fantastic Marriott "Revival" beds. All of the details are thought through and top shelf. Everyone on the staff has made sure that all the T's are crossed and the I's are dotted. As a Platinum Marriott member I get a free breakfast with my room. This hotel has been so kind as to let me have a room service breakfast instead of having to schlep down to the restaurant. That is so nice when you have a few more work things to complete before heading out for the day. I'm looking forward to my next few trips. I was even able to find time to go to the spa, which is just gorgeous. If you can stay here, make sure that you do. You will be glad you did.

Staying at this hotel is a treat! The facility is beautifully maintained. The common spaces and rooms are spotless. Very comfortable bed with lots of pillows and a nice fluffy duvet. Ordered room service breakfast as an extra treat over the Thanksgiving holiday. It was delivered at the requested time and everything was perfect. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is right on the Erie Canal and is walking distance from the very quaint Pittsford downtown area. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Delightful!

reviews.text: My wife, daughter and I stayed for 4 nights in late August in adjoining rooms. The facilities were wonderful -- pool, Jacuzzi, bar, workout room -- and the amenities plentiful -- newspapers (including the NYT and Journal), internet hookup, etc., as promised. Furthermore, the Del Monte enjoys an excellent location in town and the place is brand new and looks it. In general we loved the place until the last day:
reviews.title: Heavenly -- Almost!
My husband and I stayed at the Delmonte in June for a romantic getaway. What a w
reviews.text: We had planned to sleep-in after a late night and leave refreshed for

We arrived at about 9pm, and were checked-in within minutes. The staff had previously set up a crib for us, so it was easy to settle in. The railroad noise did not bother us. The room was a bit small, but nicely appointed and very clean. The pool heater was not working correctly, but the staff were working on correcting this. The hotel itself is beautiful and everyone was very helpful and friendly. The bike path along the canal is next to the hotel, and the setting was lovely. I would definately return.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.text: A great location in the middle of the cute Village of Pittsford. Lots of restaurants and quaint shops within easy walking. Staff was friendly and accomodating and rooms were comfortable, although the bathroom was very small. The only real problem with our room was that the train track is within a few hundred yards of the hotel and our room faced it. Each night we were treated to the sounds of 2 or 3 trains.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel but ask for a room away from the RR tracks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I took a one night holiday at the Del Monte Lodge. We had spent the day at Letchworth State Park and wanted a nice place to unwind. The staff was great the room and the room was great. Very comfortable bedding. The indoor pool was just the right size for cooling off from the 95º temps outside. Did not try the restaurant as we had plans to meet friends who live in Rochester. We would definitely choose this hotel again. Very convenient and in a lovely town.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: Stayed for one night in July and was pleasantly impressed with the service, quality of room, food, and the spa. This was a very relaxing visit despite the brief stay, and I really enjoyed walking around the town of Pittsford. The front desk, room service, and bellhops were all excellent and the breakfast was fabulous. Very clean facility and will stay again next time I'm in the area.
reviews.title: Great place in quaint village town

reviews.text: I recently spent some time at the Renaissance Del Monte. I went in with high expectations based on the feedback on this site. I will first stress that the hotel has no significant issues. Neither is it the heaven on earth that many of the posters found. The spa was closed when I was there so perhaps my stress level was higher than others.
reviews.title: Midrange with good service

reviews.text: A very relaxing place for a hotel - right on the Erie Canal. There's a spa adjacent so you can get a massage after a long, long walk. It's also close to the town of Pittsford for shopping and dining.
reviews.title: Delightful Place!

likes.liked: — Unique location on the Erie Canal

reviews.text: Staying here is a very unique experience, and I can't wait to go back. I loved it!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Pittsford and the Del Monte Lodge surpassed all of our expectations. The hotel was spotless, the beds were extremely comfortable (great for four overworked and then overshopped women!) and the staff was fantastic. The bell staff and housekeepers responded almost instantly to our requests and the front desk staff were genuine and personable.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Rochester

reviews.text: The location is excellent as well, walking distance to cafes, restaurants and steps from a great walking/running trail on the Erie Canal.
reviews.title: Amazing Staff

reviews.text: We recently moved from the Rochester area for work and are making trips back 3-4 times per year. We have stayed at the Del Monte on three of our first trips home and won't stay anywhere else in the future. It is a little out of the from the expressway and NYS Thruway, but the extra 10 minutes is well worth the service.
reviews.title: Fantastic property
